events.name: pgDay Asia
events.description:
We will have our next meetup along with pgDay Asia on 17th March 2016. pgDay Asia is the first pan-Asia Postgres Conference to be held alongside FOSSASIA. We have a dedicated day on 17th March 2016, only for PostgreSQL related topics. On 19th March 2016 we have dedicated track alongside FOSSASIA 


Please RSVP for the event and register yourself on pgDay Asia site: http://2016.pgday.asia Registration is to be done on pgDay Asia site- http://pgday-asia-2016.peatix.com/ The Event Program is published over here- http://2016.pgday.asia/#program Those who are interested in attending the 2nd day of the pgDay Asia can register online on FOSSASIA site- http://www.eventnook.com/event/register/56463
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Let's meet up with Speakers and Participants of FOSSASIA at Red Hat Singapore
events.description: Let's meet up at with speakers and participants of FOSSASIA at Red Hat's Singapore office for coffee and snacks and, more importantly, to exchange cool ideas and projects.  The meetup is hosted by FOSSASIA organizer Harish Pillay. Red Hat is on the 10th floor of the AXA Tower. FOSSASIA: http://2016.fossasia.org Harish Pillay: https://twitter.com/harishpillay
events.location: Red Hat, 8 Shenton Way, 10-01 AXA Tower, 068811 Singapore

events.name: Become an official photography "angel" at FOSSASIA with Michael Cannon
events.description:
Michael Cannon from the US will provide a training to become an official photographer at the FOSSASIA summit. So, you can be a "FOSSASIA 2016 photo angel". During this session you will learn the basic concepts of photography and get into details like "the rule of thirds". This special training is designed for FOSSASIA volunteers who would like to learn how to take high quality photos during the FOSSASIA summit.  Please also join the team through our Volunteer Registration Form. 


Equipment Michael has some professional equipment that he will use to teach us. Please also bring your camera and mobile phones. Good photos can be taken with all kinds of equipment. You will be surprised!  FOSSASIA 2016 in Singapore, March 18-20 http://2016.fossasia.org Photography Trainer Michael Cannon - Michael is Axelerant’s Chief Operations Officer and has extended knowledge of PHP. He’s been coding since 1984 and started managing people in 1999. Before joining Axelerant Michael was a top seller of plugins for both Wordpress and Drupal. Today his work focuses on talent acquisition, professional development, management mentoring, guiding company culture, and overseeing daily operations. Michael considers Taiwan home, but can also be found on a farm in Italy or watching sunsets outside of Seattle with his family. He’s an avid cyclist, serious world traveler, and voracious science fiction reader. A slow year to him is a few thousand kilometers ridden, 10 countries visited, and a 100 books read. Don’t ask about normal years.  Michael on Flickr: https://www.flickr.com/photos/comprock/ 


FOSSASIA Summit 2016 Website: 2016.fossasia.org Twitter: http://twitter.com/fossasia
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, Fermi Lab (Level 2), 15 Science Centre Road , Singapore 609081

events.name: Singapore SQL PASS Chapter - March 2016 Meetup
events.description: Dear All, Brace yourself!!! This month at Singapore SQL Pass Chapter (User Group), we are going to have two eminent speakers presenting on couple of most happening topics on SQL Server. On March 17th, we will have Mr. Edwin Sarimento (MCM, MVP) and Mr. Martin Catherall ( MVP, Regional Mentor - APAC - SQLPASS) sharing their knowledge in our user group. I extend a warm welcome to both of them on the behalf of SG SQL PASS Chapter. I strongly urge everyone to attend the meetup, as sessions as this one are mostly available only on paid conferences and technical summits. Don't miss it!!! Venue, Agenda and Event details are provided below. Agenda:  Mar 17th - 6:45 PM to 7 PM - Registration and Snacks 7 PM to 8:15 PM - Topic 1 - Presentation by Edwin Sarimento 8:15 PM to 8:30 - Break 8:30 PM to 9:30 - Topic 2 - Presentation by Martin Catherall Location: Microsoft Office, One Marina Boulevard, Conf Room SINOMB 22CF-15 (24) AV Topic 1: 5 Things To Consider: Stretching SQL Server Failover Clustered Instances and Availability Groups to Microsoft Azure Dealing with SQL Server Failover Clustered Instances and Availability Group for local high availability is already complicated with a lot of the external dependencies such as the network and the Windows Server Failover Cluster (WSFC.) But it becomes even more complicated when you stretch it out for disaster recovery to Microsoft Azure. In this session, learn the five (5) things that you need to consider when you implement SQL Server Failover Clustered Instances and Availability Group for disaster recovery into Microsoft Azure. We will cover how Active Directory, DNS, WSFC heartbeat and quorum configuration affects deployments of SQL Server Failover Clustered Instances and Availability Group in a disaster recovery site and how to properly configure a client application for connectivity. Speaker Profile: Edwin Sarimento Edwin M. Sarmiento is the Managing Director of 15C, a consulting and training company that specializes on designing, implementing and supporting SQL Server infrastructures. He is a  Microsoft SQL Server MVP and Microsoft Certified Master from Ottawa, Canada specializing in high availability, disaster recovery and system infrastructures running on the Microsoft server technology stack ranging from Active Directory to SharePoint and anything in between. He is very passionate about technology but has interests in music, professional and organizational development, and leadership and management matters when not working with databases. Edwin lives up to his primary mission statement: "To help people and organizations grow and develop their full potential." Topic 2:  A Lap around Columnstore Columnstore indexing was first introduced in SQL Server 2012, however it was not widely adopted.SQL Server 2014 added additional functionality to columnstore which resulted in a marginally higher uptake. The initial versions required some creative thinking to get all of the promised performance gains out of the technology. Now, SQL Server 2016 enhances this functionality greatly and it’s all set to become mainstream. Columnstore promises significant performance gains for datawarehouses along with operational analytics. This presentation will look at many of the new features in columnstore as well as briefly look at some of the internals and give the audience some insight into how they can leverage its potential. Speaker Profile: Martin Catherall Martin is a RockSolid SQL consultant, a SQL Server MVP, PASS Regional Mentor for the Asia Pacific (APAC) region and until recently leader of the Christchurch, New Zealand SQL Server User Group. Now based in Melbourne, he’s getting to know the Australian SQL community. He has been using SQL Server in various roles since 2000. In addition to anything data related be enjoys playing the guitar and having fun with his family.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Template Scripts for Beginners!
events.description:
Hi All, After absence for 2 months, we are back! We going to have meetup and talk about Azure Resource Manager (ARM) template scripts. It will be #LSFD (less slides, full demos) meetup. This is for beginners (not just for Azure beginners) who don't understand how to create Cloud Infrastructure by just using a simple JSON text file. No, it's not Powershell file, no coding scripts. It's just a JSON text file. This text file can than be executed in Azure Resource Manager. Here is what you will get from the talk: 1. Understand what is ARM and what is Template Scripts, what is JSON (for those who don't know). 2. Understand how to create a simple implicit VM using ARM scripts and execute in Azure. Update the scripts and automate it. 3. Translate (interpret) an architectural design and generate the Scripts. 4. Creating more complex design such as multiple VMs with Virtual Network, Load Balancers, MySql, DocumentDB, App Services, etc. 5. Accessing ARM through API using .NET (as an example). 5. And lots of Live Demos. So, basically ARM template scripts is like your cloud infrastructure meta data file (blueprint file) that can be edited/saved and reuse or for automation. 


SPEAKER Azure Cloud Expert Juv Chan (Chan Kae Siang). He Studied Computer Engineering at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore back in 2004. 


Seriously, this will be tons of new knowledge for beginners and you don't want to miss this topic. See you at the venue! Organizers,Riza
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Design Thinking - Make your ideas tangible using rapid prototyping
events.description:
Stop spending too much time thinking about the ideas, make it tangible and get feedback quickly. Learn the basic understanding of using rapid physical prototyping made out of aluminium foils and implement the design process.  

In this series, we will talk about: • 15min: Networking • 25min: Mini-talk on Rapid Prototyping. (Why we prototype? The importance of "Building to Think" approach and the do's and don'ts of prototyping.) • 5min: Activity review. • 30min: Hands-on activities - build your own physical prototype, and share what you made. • 20min: Discussion. • 5min: Wrapping up. *Materials will be provided at the event. -------------------------------------------------------------- 


About the facilitator for this session: Teo Choong Ching is a UX Designer at Rakuten Viki, raised in Malaysia and currently living in Singapore. He strives to craft simple and useful experiences that inform and delight users. His interests include interactive design fundamentals, UX design, visual storytelling and digital narrative forms. He worked at AsiaRooms, Aleph-Labs, Proximity BBDO and OgilvyOne. When he's not designing you'll find him wandering with his camera in the streets or fumbling with his VR headset.
events.location: Rakuten Crimson House, 138 Market Street, Lvl 32, CapitaGreen, 048946, Singapore

events.name: FOSSASIA Pre-Meetup at Bugis - Steamboat and Get together at Blu Jaz Cafe
events.description:
Let’s join up for a pre-meetup with FOSSASIA speakers and participants already in town. We start off with a traditional Singapore hotpot at Beach Road and then meet up at Jaz Blue Cafe in Bugis. Call Darwin (+6581183779), if you don't find us. 


ITINERARY 7.00 pm Dinner: Enjoy a traditional Singapore Hotpot/Steamboat at Bugis Beach Road. There is an option for a flatrate and lots of yummy seafood. Address: Chong Qing (Original) Steamboat Hotpot 重庆正宗老火锅, #01-02 Chye Sing Building, 75 Beach Road 8.30 pm Walk: Walk over to Blu Jaz 9.00 pm Bar: Let’s get some drinks just a few steps away after dinner at Blu Jaz Cafe, 11 Bali Lane , Nearest MRT : Bugis, Singapore 10.00 pm: Head to hotel 


PUBLIC TRANSPORT Directions: Public Transport: Go to Bugis MRT Station and walk to Beach Road. Look out for our group of international geeks and designers in the Beach Road Seafood Hotpot restaurant at the corner. BLUE JAZ CAFE • http://www.blujazcafe.net • Serves beer, wine, and additional finger food • If a lot of people sign up, we will reserve the 2nd floor LINKS FOSSASIA: http://fossasia.org Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia
events.location: Chong Qing Steam Boat Restaurant, 75 Beach Road (S)189689, Singapore

events.name: PyLadies Django + ReactJS Workshop
events.description:
This is a slightly more advanced workshop that demonstrates how you can use Django with ReactJS. This will be extremely useful for people who already know Django, but the actual Django part is very very easy, so people who just want to get first exposure to ReactJS will also benefit from this.

We will actually be doing more JavaScript code in this workshop than Python code (but they both look very similar, so don't be afraid).

If you have never done any web development at all, you will be able to follow the workshop and see something in your browser, but you might not fully understand WHY and HOW it works. Might still be fun, though ;)

The tutorial that we will be doing can be found here: https://github.com/mbrochh/django-reactjs-boilerplate

Please RSVP only if you are sure that you are coming and if you suddenly realize that you can't make it, please un-RSVP so that we can plan better how much Pizza we need to buy.
events.location: 5 Temasek Boulevard, Level 7, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore 038985

events.name: Design Innovation Dialogue - Celebrating over 1000 members
events.description: The Design Innovation Singapore community will come together every month to chat, socialise and have a dialogue about topics such as Human-centred Design, Design Thinking in different industries, Creativity in Teams and Innovation Practices in Organisations. We welcome all creatives, innovators, startup entrepreneurs, technologists, consultants, bankers, educators, policy makers and everyone interested in Design Innovation in Singapore. Come and meet an interdisciplinary group, make the right connections and build the Design Innovation community Singapore. See you from 7.00pm.
